qas.question: Who can only handle the ball with their hands or arms during play?
When is it okay for regular players to use their hands?
A ball cannot be received in what type of position?
throughout when can players move the ball in any direction?
Who can only handle the ball with their feet during play?
When is it okay for irregular players to use their hands?
What type of position can a ball always be received in?
When can players move the ball in no direction?

context: The primary law is that players other than <a0_0><b4_0>goalkeepers<b4_0/><a0_0/> may not deliberately handle the ball with their hands or arms during play, though they do use their hands during a <a1_0><b5_0>throw-in restart<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Although players usually use their feet to move the ball around, they may use any part of their body (notably, "heading" with the forehead) other than their hands or arms. Within normal play, all players are free to play the ball in any direction and move throughout <a3_0><b7_0>the pitch<b7_0/><a3_0/>, though the ball cannot be received in an <a2_0><b6_0>offside<b6_0/><a2_0/> position.
